Procs for editing module data.

Imports

common, data

Types

PasteMode = enum
  overwrite, mix
Modes of operation when pasting pattern data.
  • overwrite: default, source data overwrites destination data.
  • mix: Source data is only pasted when the destination column is empty. In other words, the pasted data mixes with the existing data at the destination.
Source   Edit   
PatternAnchor = object
  row*: int
  track*: int
  select*: TrackSelect
A position inside a pattern similiar to PatternCursor, except that it uses TrackSelect as the column coordinate. Two anchors are needed to make a PatternSelection, which are the starting and ending corners of a selection. Source   Edit   
PatternClip = object
A partial copy of pattern data that can be pasted elsewhere. Source   Edit   
PatternCursor = object
  row*: int
  track*: int
  column*: TrackColumn
A position inside a pattern. Source   Edit   
PatternSelection = object
  rows*: Slice[int]
  tracks*: Slice[int]
  selects*: Slice[TrackSelect]
A selection is a span of rows, tracks and selects within a pattern. Visual representation of a selection is equivalent to a rectangle, with the rows being the y coordinates, and the tracks, selects as the x coordinates.
  • rows: The starting and ending row of the selection.
  • tracks: The starting and ending track of the selection.
  • selects: The starting and ending column of the selection.
Source   Edit   
SelectionFit = enum
  nothing,                  ## nothing is selected: selection is invalid or out of bounds
  partial,                  ## some of the selection fits the pattern
  whole                      ## all of the selection fits within the pattern
Enum of possible fits, or how much the selection actually selects in a pattern. Use this to check for validity. Source   Edit   
TrackColumn = enum
  colNote,                  ## The note
  colInstrumentHi,          ## The high-nibble of instrument
  colInstrumentLo,          ## The low-nibble of instrument
  colEffectType1,           ## The effect type byte for effect no 1
  colEffectParamHi1,        ## The high-nibble of effect param for effect no 1
  colEffectParamLo1,        ## The low-nibble of effect param for effect no 1
  colEffectType2,           ## The effect type byte for effect no 2
  colEffectParamHi2,        ## The high-nibble of effect param for effect no 2
  colEffectParamLo2,        ## The low-nibble of effect param for effect no 2
  colEffectType3,           ## The effect type byte for effect no 3 
  colEffectParamHi3,        ## The high-nibble of effect param for effect no 3
  colEffectParamLo3          ## The low-nibble of effect param for effect no 3
Enum of columns within a track Source   Edit   
TrackSelect = enum
  selNote,                  ## The note
  selInstrument,            ## The instrument
  selEffect1,               ## Effect no 1
  selEffect2,               ## Effect no 2
  selEffect3                 ## Effect no 3
Enum of columns within a track that can be selected. Source   Edit  

Consts

noSelection = (rows: (a: 0, b: -1), tracks: (a: 0, b: -1),
               selects: (a: selNote, b: selNote))
Constant for a selection that has no selection whatsoever. Source   Edit  

Procs

func clamped(s: PatternSelection; trackLen = TrackLen(256)): PatternSelection {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Calculates a new selection that is clamped in order to be a valid selection for a pattern of the given length. If the selection does not intersect the pattern region whatsoever, noSelection is returned. Source   Edit   
func contains(s: PatternSelection; pos: PatternAnchor): bool {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Determine if a selection, s, contains an anchor, pos. Source   Edit   
func data(c: PatternClip): lent seq[TrackRow] {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Access the clip's data buffer. The data is stored in the order specified by the clip's selection, from left-to-right (first track to last track) and top-to-bottom (first row to last row). Source   Edit   
func effectNumber(column: TrackSelect): int {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Gets the effect index of the select. 0 is returned If column is not an effect. Source   Edit

func moved(s: PatternSelection; pos: PatternAnchor): PatternSelection {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Calculates a new selection by moving s to start at pos. The resulting selection may be invalid. Source   Edit   
proc paste(c: PatternClip; pattern: var Pattern; trackLen: TrackLen;
           pos: PatternAnchor; mode = overwrite) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}

Pastes or copies the clip's stored data into a pattern at the given starting position.

mode determines how the data is copied over, see PasteMode for details.

If the clip does not have any data then this proc does nothing. Any invalid track in the pattern will be ignored.

Source   Edit   
proc paste(dest: var TrackRow; selected: Slice[TrackSelect]; src: TrackRow;
           mode = overwrite) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Copies the selected columns from src onto dest, using the given paste mode. See PasteMode for more details on the possible modes. Source   Edit   
func pos(s: PatternSelection): PatternAnchor {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Gets the starting position of the selection, as an anchor Source   Edit   
proc restore(c: PatternClip; pattern: var Pattern; trackLen: TrackLen) {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Restores previously clipped data at its original location. Source   Edit   
proc save(c: var PatternClip; pattern: PatternView; trackLen: TrackLen;
          region: PatternSelection) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Saves a portion of pattern data in the given song to a clip.
  • pattern: the pattern data to save from, invalid tracks are accepted.
  • trackLen: the length of the pattern, in rows.
  • region: is the selected region in the pattern to save.

If the region's fit is not whole, then nothing will be saved. See SelectionFit and getFit for more details.

Source   Edit   
func selection(c: PatternClip): PatternSelection {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Gets the region of the clipped data as a pattern selection. Source   Edit

Convert a cursor to an anchor. Source   Edit   
func toSelect(column: TrackColumn): TrackSelect {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Convert a column to a selectable column. Source   Edit   
func trackSelects(s: PatternSelection; track: int): Slice[TrackSelect] {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Gets the starting and ending selects within a single track of a pattern selection.

If the given track is not in the selection's span of tracks, then all columns are selected.

Source   Edit
